intro: Oreodaphne caracasana, commonly known as the Caracas holly, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically orange or red in color. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
